title: Paramedic is 'bashed by teenage thugs' during a charity ride
text:
An off-duty paramedic was knocked down and bashed by a gang of teenagers during a charity bike ride.

Daniel Mansbridge was riding 1,000km in a month to raise money for children's cancer when a youth jumped in front of him on a bridge on Friday.

The 42-year-old was just 7km into his ride near Shellbarbour, south of Wollongong, and flung over the handlebars as he braked heavily.

Off-duty paramedic Daniel Mansbridge, 42, was knocked down and bashed by a gang of teenagers during a charity bike ride

He suffered an orbital floor fracture in the bottom of his left eye socket and was rushed to hospital after he called his ambulance colleagues

He was not badly injured and got to his feet to admonish the boy, but was attacked by a group of up to 10 older teenagers.

'They just whaled on me. On the ground and blood was just pouring out of me,' he told the Daily Telegraph.

Mr Mansbridge said they stopped beating him and apologised when he explained he just wanted to talk to the younger boy about his dangerous prank.

They retrieved his bike, headphones, and other gear which had been strewn across the road in the scuffle.

He suffered an orbital floor fracture in the bottom of his left eye socket and was rushed to hospital after he called his ambulance colleagues.

Mr Mansbridge will have surgery on his eye at Wollongong Hospital in coming weeks and a fundraiser is hoping to get $5,000 in donations to help with his bills.

Police are investigating the attack and are looking for up to 10 people who are believed to be involved.

His mother Mary Mansbridge appealed for witnesses to come forward and promised he would finish the ride when he recovered.

'Kids cancer is a cause close to all our heart... let's get behind Dan after this ugly assault and help him reach his goal,' she wrote.

'He will get back on his bike and complete this challenge but it's going to take a while til he's able to do this now.'
description: Daniel Mansbridge was riding 1,000km in NSW for cancer when a boy jumped in front of him, knocking him off the bike. When he got up to admonish the boy he was bashed by group of older teenagers.
authors: Nic White For Daily Mail Australia
